title: Fix lobby thumbnail border radius by clipping media inside a rounded wrapper

requirements.text: Update lobby chatroom card thumbnails so the visible media (including when using `object-fit: contain`) is clipped to rounded corners by wrapping the `` (and any overlay layers) in a rounded container with `overflow-hidden`, across all thumbnail types (YouTube, Twitch, Twitter/X, and generic media).
acceptanceCriteria: In the Lobby (chatroom cards), thumbnails visually show rounded corners for all media types (YouTube/Twitch/Twitter/other), even when the image does not fill the container due to `object-contain`.
No square/uncut corners are visible around thumbnails during normal display or on hover.
Existing hover effects (e.g., image scale on hover) still work and remain clipped within the rounded thumbnail bounds.
Changes are implemented in the existing lobby card thumbnail component (e.g., `frontend/src/components/ChatroomCard.tsx`) without introducing backend changes.

constraints: Do not modify files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook/entry files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Backend remains single-actor; no backend changes are required for this UI-only fix.
nonGoals: Changing thumbnail aspect ratio, sizing, or switching away from `object-fit: contain`.
Adding new media types or changing thumbnail fetching logic (YouTube/Twitch/Twitter).
Redesigning the lobby page layout beyond what is necessary to ensure rounded thumbnail clipping.
